review_reason: Phase 1 analysis proved that constant witness families fundamentally cannot satisfy the truth lemma backward G/H direction. The two-tier BMCS approach in the plan is mathematically impossible. The sorry in fully_saturated_bmcs_exists_int represents an architectural gap between BMCS modal requirements (multiple families) and temporal requirements (non-constant families). User must decide: (A) refactor BMCS semantics for D=CanonicalMCS, (B) eliminate DovetailingChain sorries to enable non-constant witnesses, or (C) accept sorry as architectural limitation.

artifacts.summary: Phase 1 analysis completed: constant witness families are mathematically incompatible with truth lemma temporal backward. All plan phases blocked.

partial_progress.details: Phase 1 (truth lemma call graph analysis) completed successfully. Found that the IMP case creates a mutual dependency between forward and backward directions at ALL families. Through the Box case, this propagates to require backward G/H at witness families. For constant families, backward G requires phi in M -> G(phi) in M, which is FALSE. Phases 2-5 blocked: the two-tier BMCS approach with constant witness families cannot satisfy the truth lemma.

errors.message: The truth lemma (bmcs_truth_lemma) requires temporal coherence (forward_F, backward_P) at ALL families in the BMCS, not just the eval family. Constant witness families cannot satisfy backward G: phi in M does not imply G(phi) in M. This is a mathematical obstruction, not a technical gap. The two-tier BMCS approach from the plan is fundamentally flawed.
errors.recommendation: Three viable alternatives: (A) Refactor BMCS to use D=CanonicalMCS with modified Box semantics quantifying over domain elements instead of families. (B) Eliminate DovetailingChain forward_F/backward_P sorries and build non-constant witness families. (C) Accept the sorry as an architectural limitation requiring BMCS redesign.
